author: Wes Adams
title: Celebrate Friendsgiving In Colorado's Scenic Vineyards - NewsBreak
text:
By Wes Adams ,
3 hours ago
If you’re craving something different this Thanksgiving , Colorado’s Western Slope is the perfect place to switch things up. Maybe this is the year you swap the usual turkey routine for a Friendsgiving in wine country—celebrating under wide-open November skies.
If a scenic winery near the Colorado River sounds better than stuffing all your friends into your living room for an afternoon, keep scrolling to check out a few Palisade wineries and orchards offering fresh ideas.
Why Host Friendsgiving at a Western Colorado Winery or Orchard? Getty Images/iStockphoto Wine country in November comes with all the late-fall and early winter feels, as the Palisade and Grand Junction vineyards have plenty to offer for harvest season. Enjoy locally grown produce, easy access to unique local wines, and a relaxed atmosphere custom-made for relaxing with friends. Hosting them among the Western Colorado orchards and vineyards gives friends and family something extra to remember.
Suggested Venues for a Western Colorado Friendsgiving Getty Images Here are three standout venues to consider:
Maison la Belle Vie — Location: 3575 G Road, Palisade, CO 81526. Amenities : A 4.5-acre vineyard with a rustic-elegant tasting room and courtyard (Amy’s Courtyard) that is marketed for private events. They serve charcuterie boards and seasonal menus on-site, offering an upscale yet relaxed setting.
Grande River Vineyards / Ten Acre Winery — Location: 787 Grande River Drive, Palisade, CO 81526. Amenities : Estate-style vineyard with a fully built event infrastructure—including a hotel next door, private event planning services, and spaces for group gatherings—ideal for a larger Friendsgiving with both wine tasting and communal dinner.
Colterris Winery — Location: 3907 N River Road, Palisade, CO 81526 (also Overlook location: 3548 E½ Road). Amenities : Colorado’s largest fully estate-grown winery, with multiple tasting rooms and scenic options, and capabilities for large-group requests by phone. They offer wine tastings, panoramic views, and flexible event settings.
Logistics for November Friendsgiving One thing to remember about planning a Friendsgiving is that it happens around Thanksgiving, not during it. Plan a date before or after holiday travel peaks. Mid-November weekends work best. Check to see if the venue you are interested in allows outside catering or has in-house options.
Will you need to rent tables? What about heaters? Fire pits can make a huge difference if the weather turns chilly. There is a lot to consider, but once the day arrives, you will love that you found a way to create a unique Western Slope experience for your friends.
Getty Images/iStockphoto Download the KEKB Mobile App Now 15 Colorado Wine Rooms With Near Perfect Reviews Colorado is loaded with awesome wine bars and wine tasting rooms. You'll find them in every major city, and in a number of smaller communities. Check out the Google Reviews, and you'll find some of these wine rooms boast perfect 5-star reviews. Several others scored 4.8 and 4.9 stars from reviewers. Take a quick tour of these amazing wine rooms. Gallery Credit: Waylon Jordan Google Maps / Canva SIPS On Main - Cedaredge SIPS on Main in Cedaredge packs an amazing 5-star rating based on 21 reviews. You'll find them at 215 W Main St Suite A, just a few doors from an awesome guitar shop, and not too far from Cedaredge Arts and Events center. Google Maps / Canva Sips On Main map Google Maps / Canva Crush Wine Bar - Castle Rock Crush Wine Bar scored an awesome 4.8 stars based on 288 reviews. They can be found at 3911 Ambrosia St Ste 101 in Castle Rock. In addition to the wine and food, some reviews mentioned the business to be an excellent event venue. Google Maps / Canva Crush Wine Bar map Google Maps / Canva Carlson Vineyards Downtown - Grand Junction This venue in downtown Grand Junction scored an impressive 4.8 stars on Google. You'll find it on the 500 block of Main Street, just a few doors down from the historic Avalon Theatre. Google Maps / Canva Carlson Vineyards Downtown map Google Maps / Canva Cana Wine Bar - Denver Scoring 4.8 stars based on 189 reviews, Cana Wine Bar can be found at 2554 S Broadway in Denver. Reviews describe the place as "cozy," while highlighting the great selection of wine, and the fact "...the owner knows his stuff." Google Maps / Canva Cana Wine Bar map Google Maps / Canva Vines 79 Winery & Vineyard - Palisade This room packs a perfect 5 stars based on 20 Google Reviews. You'll find them at 3839 G Road in Palisade . Reviewers loved the ambience, the vibes, and people. One reviewer wrote, "...the people and the wines can't be beat." Google Maps / Canva Vines 79 Winery & Vineyard map Google Maps / Canva Vin Rouge Wine Bar & Tasting Room - Denver Vin Rouge Wine Bar & Tasting Room is as close to perfect as you can get, scoring an awesome 4.9 stars. They can be found at 4412 Yates Street in Denver. This venue is described as a "gem" for Denver. Google Maps / Canva Vin Rouge Wine Bar & Tasting Room map Google Maps / Canva The Wine Barrel - Parker The Wine Barrel at 11495 Twenty Mile Road in Parker scored an impressive 4.8 stars. Reviewers recommend joining the VIP club. A review from Steve V says, "This is a great little family winery. The wine is fantastic and the smoked wine is a unique treat. No other winery is doing THAT!!" The Wine Barrel map Google Maps / Canva Water 2 Wine - Centennial Water 2 Wine can be found at 8130 South University Boulevard #110 in Centennial. Reviews are awesome at 4.8 stars. One reviewer wrote, "Huge selection and fun friendly staff that clearly knows their business." Google Maps / Canva Water 2 Wine map Google Maps / Canva Taste and Savor Wine Bar - Fort Collins The Taste and Savor Wine Bar at 3581 E. Harmony Road #130 in Fort Collins scored an impressive 4.8 stars on Google. Reviewers make a point to mention the excellent service. Google Maps / Canva Taste and Savor Wine Bar map Google Maps / Canva Talon Wines at the Meadery - Palisade Talon Wines at the Meadery scored an impressive 4.8 stars based on 108 reviews. This pet-friendly venue can be found at 3701 G Road in Palisade. A review from Matthew H reads, "The scene was unassuming and relaxed atmosphere. The wine, mead, and fruit wines were all tasty and creative. We really enjoyed the relaxed attitude and kick back attitude of the tasting room." Google Maps / Canva Talon Wines at the Meadery map Google Maps / Canva Attimo Wine - Denver Attimo Wine at 2246 Larimer Street in Denver scored an awesome 4.8 stars. According to the reviews, Attimo Wine is the perfect break from Denver's bar scene. Patrick S writes, "A wonderful place to taste and learn about Italian wines. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable and are eager to answer any questions." Google Maps / Canva Attimo Wine map Google Maps / Canva The Ordinary Fellow - Palisade One of the highest rated venues on this list, The Ordinary Fellow scored an incredible 4.9 stars. Located at 202 Peach Avenue in Palisade, they are a "wonderful new addition to Peach Street." Google Maps / Canva The Ordinary Fellow map www.518winebar.com 518 Wine Bar - Craig You'll find 518 Wine Bar at 518 Yampa Avenue in Craig, Colorado. This room scored a perfect 5 out of 5 stars. Patrons love the 1920s atmosphere and the friendly service. Google Maps / Canva 518 Wine Bar Map Google Maps / Canva Saved By The Wine - Dillon Save By The Wine scored an impressive 4.9 out of 5 stars. They can be found at 765 W Anemone Trail in Dillon. One review states, "Soft ambiance, kind staff, culinary curiosities, and the finest wines await." Google Maps / Canva Saved By The Wine map Chill Switch Wines - Cedaredge Another venue scoring a perfect 5 out of 5 stars, Chill Switch Wines can be found at 24621 Tannin Road in Cedaredge, Colorado. Their webpage states, "We are a small winery that uses 100% Colorado grapes and we strive for minimal handling or adulteration with our winemaking methods." Google Maps / Canva Chill Switch Wines map Enjoy Delicious Libations at These Grand Junction Breweries Grand Junction, Colorado is home to a number of outstanding wineries, distilleries, and breweries. The craft brewery phenomenon is growing by leaps and bounds with dozens of new breweries scheduled to open in Colorado in 2023.
Right now, a number of locally-crafted breweries are thriving in Western Colorado. If you're a craft beer connoisseur, you'll definitely want to visit each of these Grand Junction area breweries.
